intro: Physaria vicina, commonly known as the bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, rounded pods that resemble bladders. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces yellow flowers with four petals. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Physaria vicina is an annual plant that completes its life cycle within a single growing season.
